intro: Schefflerodendron adenopetalum, commonly known as the Chinese holly or Chinese evergreen, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are edible for birds but toxic to humans. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments. Schefflerodendron adenopetalum is also valued for its air-purifying properties and is used in traditional Chinese medicine.
